nodes.bodyText: This is a little redundant. Bukkit.getOfflinePlayer(...) will return an online player if possible anyway, so potentially calling this twice makes little sense, can pretty much just call Bukkit.getOfflinePlayer(...) right away
Also make sure to add the new permission and command to the wiki
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -37,6 +37,9 @@ permissions:
   slimefun.command.versions:
     description: Allows you to do /sf versions
     default: op
+  slimefun.command.backpack:
+    description: Allows you to do /sf backpack
+    default: op

nodes.bodyText: Please add a space after the comma
Pretty sure you can just use BackpackListener#setBackpackId(...) or so here, might have to look into that
Should probably also send a message like "Heres your backpack" or so
Variable is only ever used once, no point in it
Looks very long, I assume this is over column limit?
Redundant brackets around hasPermission statement
Make this a SlimefunItemStack
Why? All of them are ItemStack, it would not be coherent
They're being moved to SlimefunItemStack. ItemStack is the old shit. You're right now just causing stupidly useless casts.
Never set the backpack ID or anything...
Pretty sure you can do BackpackListener#setBackpackId(...) her... wait a second didn't I already say that?
I think I mistakenly resolved it and didn't read it heh now it's resolved
Should maybe rather be called "RestoredBackpack". Also please add adequate javadocs here.

Why exactly is this in the "guide" section? Doesn't seem to have anything to do with the Slimefun guide to me.
Should probably rather be in the "commands" section.

+    backpack-does-not-exist: '&4That backpack does not exist!'
+    restored-backpack-given: 'Backpack restored successfully! Added to your inventory!'

nodes.bodyText: Rather use the word "number", "integer" does not appear to be so user-friendly. Also maybe call it "backpack id" rather than just "id"
